intro: Amsinckia subintegra, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has a taproot system and is adapted to arid environments, with silvery-gray foliage to reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as cypsela. Amsinckia subintegra is often found in rocky soils and is a common sight in desert landscapes.
